values: I'm not allowed to buy anymore yarn until I've finished... --The Wicked for myself. Out of SWTC Karaoke. --The The Rose Wristwarmers for Monica. Out of Zara. --The somewhat modified Picovoli out of the silk/cashmere blend I bought at School Products --The The Beaded Scarf out of the cashmere/silk/merino blend from School Products. --The Sizzleout of Cherry Tree Hill Twister (although I may be permitted to buy a similar gauge black yarn, depending on what size I end up making). --The laptop bag I'm making out of Paton's Classic --The pattern-TBD sweater I'm making for my sister out of SWTC Karaoke --The self-designed and named "Autumn Girl Cabled Cardigan" out of Cascade 220. --The Peace Shawl, out of JaggerSpun Zephyr. --The Doctor Who Scarf Leftovers Felted Bag --The Lion and Lamb Clapotis --The Shepherd Sock Jaywalkers --The Hip Hop and Kidsilk Haze Loopy Liesel out of Classic Elite Miracle --Another iTARDIS --The Purl scarf with some of the Manos or Malabrigo in the stash --A felted bag with the Noro --A Tiger hat for Christie out of the Opal Rainforest Tiger 6-ply Yes folks, I have more than enough yarn for all of these projects. So why then am I so damn tempted to head out Right This Second and buy 11 balls of Felted Tweed or Silky Wool to cast on for the Tangled Yoke Cardigan out of the latest Interweave?
So, I absolutely love Ravelry. I adore it. I can spend hours on it. This is all good, I know. Better, it's great. There's just one problem: Ravelry's cutting into my knitting time.
The Doctor Who Scarf is DONE: And then we have Kit, Paula, and Jenn posing with it: Two weeks, a crapload of yarn, and more garter stitch than I hope ever to do again, but it's DONE

It's possible that I have a yarn problem. No, it's not possible; it's an absolute certainty. My weakness is Yarn On Sale. For example: SWTC Karaoke 50% Wool, 50% Soy. In Wild Cherry... And Durango... ...and Bluezzzz And Copper... ...Oh, right, and in Forest. It doesn't look so bad, until you consider I bought 7 skeins of each colorway. Yeah. That's a massive quantity of yarn, I know. But it was 70% off! The Wild Cherry and Durango are destined to be combined into Wicked. (Pink trim and pocket, grey body.) The Bluezzzz is going to become something for my sister, but don't ask me what yet. The Copper's destined for Sizzle as I've decided that I'd rather use School Products Cashmere/Silk Melange for another Picovoli. As for the Forest, I have no clue what I want to do with it, but the green's a really nice, soft color (the color in the picture's not quite right), and it wouldn't let me say no to it. I tried, really I did. Of course, all of these lovely plans are on hold until I finish the bloody Doctor Who Scarf Three hundred and twenty rows left until I can bind off, block, and add fringe. I managed about 100 rows while waiting for the new Harry Potter book tonight, and the first day I was working on it I knit something insane like 300 or 400 rows. I may end up putting in a DVD and finishing it off today. Someone please remind me why, exactly, I wanted to knit a 12 foot long garter scarf in sport weight yarn? Because I can't figure that one out.
...This will become the knitting blog I keep saying I need to start.
